p: Annually, the WHO reports approximately 67,000 cases of Japanese encephalitis, 20% to 30% of which are fatal, while 30% to 50% of survivors have significant neurological sequelae [ 51]. New strains genetically close to strains involved in previous outbreaks continue to be identified [ 52]. The St. Louis encephalitis virus was the major cause of epidemic encephalitis by an arbovirus in the USA [ 53]. It is re-emerging, causing numerous cases [ 54] ( Table S1).
